description: Writing style guide derived from 1,245 professional research reports

sample_rules: Use third person passive voice throughout. Maintain analytical distance while presenting findings.
Use third person throughout. Maintain professional, analytical tone. Present facts objectively without editorial commentary.
Use third person throughout. Maintain professional objectivity while presenting findings clearly.
Use 'we' for investigative actions ('we have identified', 'our sources'), third person for factual statements
Use first person plural ('we') for investigative actions. Maintain professional, objective tone throughout.
Use 'we' for investigation team activities. Maintain neutral, factual tone throughout.
Use first person plural for methodology and investigation process. Maintain professional analytical tone throughout.
Use 'we' for investigation team actions, third person for subjects. Maintain analytical distance while presenting findings.
Use 'we' for investigation team actions. Maintain professional analytical tone throughout.
Use third person analytical voice with investigative stance. Maintain professional objectivity while presenting findings.
Use professional investigative tone with clear factual reporting. Maintain objectivity while presenting evidence systematically.
Use third person throughout. Maintain professional investigative tone. Present facts objectively.
Use professional, courteous business correspondence tone
Direct transcript format preserving conversational flow and first-person perspective of interviewee
Use first person for source quotes ('My understanding is', 'I believe'). Third person for factual reporting.
Use first person plural (we, our) when describing company capabilities and approach. Maintain professional, confident tone throughout.
Use first person plural when describing company capabilities. Professional tone throughout with advocacy for company selection.
Use first person plural when discussing company capabilities and achievements
Use first person plural ('we would', 'we suggest') when describing proposed services. Professional but accessible tone.
Use first person plural (we, our) when describing capabilities and approach. Maintain professional consulting tone throughout.
Use first person plural 'we' when describing capabilities. Maintain professional but approachable tone.
Use first person when describing research activities. Maintain professional but approachable tone in expert outreach.
Use first person for direct witness testimony. Maintain analytical distance while providing insider perspective.
Use first person accounts from sources with direct professional experience. Maintain analytical distance while preserving source voice.
Use formal third person voice appropriate for international organization reporting. Maintain analytical neutrality.
Use formal policy analysis language with objective, evaluative tone. Avoid first person references.
Use third person analytical voice. Maintain objectivity while identifying strengths and weaknesses.
Use formal legal Croatian language with passive constructions typical of court judgments
Use formal judicial language with third person references to the Constitutional Court as decision-making body
Use passive voice for technical findings. Maintain analytical distance.
Use first person for direct outreach. Maintain professional tone in expert correspondence.
Use direct quotes and conversational language to capture authentic voice of source
Use first person plural (NLC/we) when describing capabilities and approach. Maintain formal professional tone throughout.
Use first person plural 'we' and 'our' to establish authority and direct relationship with client. Maintain professional but accessible tone.
Direct quotes from interviewed sources maintained in first person to preserve authenticity and credibility
Use analytical third person voice with detailed technical specifications and objective assessments
Use superscript footnotes for all factual claims. Include specific dates and source names.
Footnote every factual claim with superscript numbers. Include comprehensive source attribution.
Footnote factual claims with superscript numbers. Reference corporate filings, media sources, and human intelligence appropriately
Include supervisor name, position and date for verification purposes
Embed source attribution within text flow. Use specific dates and reference numbers for official communications. Quote directly from official sources when available.
Embed source attribution within text. Cite specific agencies and dates for official communications.
Attribute key factual claims and quotes to specific sources. Use bracketed footnote numbers for references.
Attribute specific claims to sources in parentheses, e.g., '(according to its annual reports)'
Attribute specific quotes and claims to source roles/organizations rather than individual names for discretion.
Clearly identify each source with role and organization. Use 'Source 1:', 'Source 2:' format for anonymized attribution.
Present as direct transcription of interview maintaining speaker's voice and terminology
Identify speakers by name and organizational role
Cite specific laws, articles, and decree numbers for every legal claim. Include full citation with date and amendment status.
Cite specific legislation, acts, and constitutional provisions for every legal claim. Include section numbers and years. Use format: Act Name (Year), Section X.
Not specified in this guidance document

exemplar_passages.passage: On 17 December 2009, the Hungarian Energy and Public Utility Regulatory Authority (MEKH) approved MOL's sale of 50% of MET Hungary to Normeston Trading Limited ("Normeston") of Belize.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Verified fact presentation with specific date, authority, and transaction details
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Provides precise attribution to regulatory source with exact date and percentage

exemplar_passages.passage: It is generally believed – and is indeed highly likely, based on both historical ownership information and media accounts – that Benjámin Lakatos, MET Group's CEO, holds the largest stake
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Uncertainty calibration for unverified claims
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly signals unverified status while indicating confidence level and evidence basis

exemplar_passages.passage: According to German corporate records and aggregators of global corporate registry data, Sebastian Betz has also had corporate affiliations with About You Open Commerce GmbH, EDITED GmbH, Sebastian Betz Beteiligungsgesellschaft mbH, Creative-Task GmbH, Collins Verwaltugs GmbH and About You Holding GmbH.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Comprehensive source attribution and systematic listing of corporate affiliations
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly attributes information to specific sources and provides complete picture of business network

exemplar_passages.passage: No adverse information pertaining to Sebastian Betz was identified.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Standard disclaimer format for negative information searches
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Provides clear statement of investigation scope and findings in professional language

exemplar_passages.passage: Sebastian Betz ('Betz') was born on 28 August 1990 in Darmstadt, Germany.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Professional entity introduction with nickname convention and key identifiers
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Establishes clear naming convention and provides essential biographical anchors

exemplar_passages.passage: Lakatos received his first multi-million dollar stake in MET Group effectively as a gift, and has since become the majority shareholder of the group without any known outside capital contribution of his own. This has led to widespread speculation that he is in fact a proxy acting on behalf of his ex-boss Hernádi
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Certainty calibration and inference presentation
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly presents facts (the gift, lack of known capital) then transitions to speculation with appropriate hedging language

exemplar_passages.passage: According to a source who worked with Lakatos at MOL, Lakatos and Hernádi became close around 2006. Recalling the time when Lakatos worked at MOL's upstream team, the source said he 'impressed' his CEO
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Source attribution and quote presentation
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Properly attributes information to specific source type and provides direct quotes with context

exemplar_passages.passage: Addiko Bank AD Podgorica ('Addiko ME') is Montenegro's eighth largest bank (out of 11) with 11 branches across the country.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Entity introduction with key context and market positioning
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Immediately establishes entity identity, scale, and market context

exemplar_passages.passage: However, we note that the background and business interests of one of Addiko ME's owners with a 5% stake, one Dieter Forster (through MW Funds PTE Limited) is not clear – several individuals called 'Dieter Forster' exist, but none who have been named in public sources could be linked to Addiko.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Transparent acknowledgment of investigative limitations with appropriate hedging
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Shows investigative rigor while being honest about constraints and uncertainties

exemplar_passages.passage: According to the filings of LW's Luxembourg-registered company Hitbox SA, his German passport was issued with no. C3FF27MH8.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Source attribution with specific document identification and factual precision
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Combines source credibility (official filings) with specific evidence (passport number) in neutral tone

exemplar_passages.passage: We have not been able to confirm the identity of the owners of these companies at this stage in our research.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Professional acknowledgment of limitations with temporal qualifier
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Maintains credibility by acknowledging data gaps while indicating ongoing investigation

exemplar_passages.passage: We have not been able to confirm the identity of the owners of these companies at this stage in our research.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Transparency about investigation limitations
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly states what could not be verified, maintaining credibility

exemplar_passages.passage: According to media reports from early October 2020, LW's Tennor invested USD 300 million... LW has not confirmed this to the media but we note the existence of two newly registered subsidiaries
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Proper hedging and corroborating evidence
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Attributes unconfirmed claims while providing supporting circumstantial evidence

exemplar_passages.passage: Due to privacy restrictions on obtaining attendance and graduation data for students without their explicit consent, we have not been able to independently confirm these qualifications with the institutions in question.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Transparency about verification limitations
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly explains why certain information could not be verified, managing client expectations about data completeness

exemplar_passages.passage: It does not appear that Sozanski bears any responsibility for the collapse of the parent company and he is indirectly described as among the group's key assets.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Exculpatory language and risk mitigation
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Proactively addresses potential concerns about association with bankruptcy, supported by media characterization

exemplar_passages.passage: SEC filings for the Liberian-registered UCIC indicate that as of 31 December 2018 it was the beneficial owner of 144,210 shares (4.5%) issued by Marshall Islands-registered company Globus Maritime Limited ('Globus').
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Precise attribution with specific dates, percentages, and jurisdictional details
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Combines verified data source, exact figures, and clear entity identification with jurisdictional context

exemplar_passages.passage: It is our understanding that under Greek law, Greek real estate records can only be obtained by a registered legal representative in the country.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Appropriate hedging for legal interpretation combined with methodological limitation
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Acknowledges uncertainty while providing specific procedural barrier information

exemplar_passages.passage: We have identified only a few, indirect connections between the principal subject, Núñez-Lagos, and the other subjects. The closest relationship we have found is between her and Professor Emmanuel Gaillard: both are senior members of the Parisian commercial arbitration community, and we even found that both spoke at the same conference in 2018, albeit on different days.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Certainty calibration and evidence hierarchy
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly states the strength of connection found, provides specific evidence, but notes the limitation (different days)

exemplar_passages.passage: According to data recorded in French corporate filings for Nunez-Lagos Arbitration, Carmen Núñez-Lagos ('Núñez-Lagos') was born on 25 May 1966 in Madrid, Spain.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Source attribution and entity introduction conventions
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly attributes to specific reliable source, establishes naming convention for remainder of report

exemplar_passages.passage: Randolphs pride themselves in referencing all members of their temporary and permanent candidates to ensure the very best staff will be supplied to our clients at all times
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Professional closing statement establishing company standards
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Reinforces thoroughness and quality assurance in recruitment process

exemplar_passages.passage: On 16 JULY 2019, we received the following email from North Tyneside Trading Standards
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Precise date attribution with official source identification
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Establishes credibility and timeline while providing clear source

exemplar_passages.passage: Safraz HUSSAIN (aka Sarfraz) (d.o.b. 5/1/1986)
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Standard format for person identification with aliases and key identifiers
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Provides complete identification package for subject tracking

exemplar_passages.passage: Trading standards in at least two cases (North Tyneside and North Yorkshire) have engaged directly with the owner of the stores and subsequent site visits have concluded that no JUUL product has been visible on sale since 30 July.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Evidence presentation with specific attribution and temporal context
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Provides precise source attribution, specific jurisdictions, and clear timeline for enforcement actions

exemplar_passages.passage: Initial research has discovered the following addresses, domains, companies and individuals linked to VAPEWITHUS:
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Clear transition from methodology to findings with structured presentation
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Sets expectation for comprehensive data presentation and organizes complex corporate network information

exemplar_passages.passage: The client engaged Rayon Intelligence Ltd ("Rayon" or "we") to conduct an investigative due diligence piece
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Professional client engagement description with entity name handling
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Establishes professional relationship and provides name conventions upfront

exemplar_passages.passage: This report was compiled from a review of publicly available sources, including media archives, online resources, proprietary databases and records
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Methodology transparency and source categorization
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Provides clear methodology without revealing specific databases or sources

exemplar_passages.passage: Corporate records show the following information:
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Authoritative statement for verified registry data
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Creates clear distinction between verified registry facts and other information types

exemplar_passages.passage: We have identified one company to which Bedding was connected, according to UK corporate records:
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Proper attribution and hedging - specifies source and uses precise language about connection
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly distinguishes between what records show versus broader claims about relationships

exemplar_passages.passage: A connection here is speculative at best but it would also be a bit of a strange coincidence, I am sure a lot more could likely be done on it, if relevant
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Explicit uncertainty calibration and scope limitation
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Acknowledges limitations while flagging potential areas for further investigation

exemplar_passages.passage: According to the BBC, 'LU Dove' was the name of mephedrone tablets. Mephedrone has been a class C controlled substance in Jersey since December 2009 and Class B in the UK since March 2010.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Source attribution followed by factual regulatory context
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Combines media reporting with verifiable legal facts to provide complete context

exemplar_passages.passage: We have identified one company to which Bedding was connected in the past, according to UK corporate records:
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Attribution and hedging language
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clear source attribution while maintaining investigative tone

exemplar_passages.passage: A connection here is speculative at best but it would also be a bit of a strange coincidence
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Uncertainty calibration
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Acknowledges limitations while noting potential significance

exemplar_passages.passage: The objective of the proposed Assignment is to investigate Terabank, its management and shareholding structure with particular focus on its controlling shareholders and beneficial owner in order to identify any potential causes for concern and/or embarrassment for the EIB.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Clear objective statement with risk-focused language
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Establishes clear scope while emphasizing reputational risk concerns specific to institutional client

exemplar_passages.passage: Terabank is registered in Georgia and its major shareholders include H. H. Sheikh Nahayan Mabarak Al Nahayan – 45%, H. H. Sheikh Hamdan Bin Zayed Al Nahayan – 20%
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Factual presentation with specific percentages and full formal names
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Provides precise ownership structure using formal titles appropriate for high-profile individuals

exemplar_passages.passage: The Service Provider shall: Identify/confirm the current direct and indirect shareholders and the jurisdiction in which they are located
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: formal task specification with clear deliverable requirements

exemplar_passages.passage: any other allegation or suspicion of illegal or disreputable practice which may pose a reputation risk for the Bank

exemplar_passages.passage: identify any potential causes for concern and/or embarrassment for the EIB

exemplar_passages.demonstrates: How to present HUMINT findings with appropriate attribution and certainty calibration

exemplar_passages.passage: Testing of the pictures via a face verification engine was undertaken, but the quality of the pictures is too poor in the Facebook images and thus it was inconclusive.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: How to document methodology limitations and inconclusive results

exemplar_passages.passage: Industry speakers unanimously claimed that Terabank, as a rather small and niche bank, is not currently involved in politics in any capacity in Georgia.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Opening with clear consensus conclusion and key entity characteristics
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Immediately establishes unanimous expert opinion and frames the entity context

exemplar_passages.passage: Former member of the Supervisory Board of the National Bank of Georgia: "The bank has an excellent national reputation..."
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Source attribution by institutional role with direct quotation
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Provides credibility through specific regulatory expertise while protecting source identity

exemplar_passages.passage: In summary, we have concluded that SUBJECT should be classified as a 'High Risk', partly as a result of its jurisdiction but primarily because all of the major shareholders are sensitive Politically Exposed Persons ("PEPs").
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Professional conclusion with clear risk classification and reasoning
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Establishes analytical authority, provides clear risk rating with specific justification

exemplar_passages.passage: An Emirati parliamentarian told us of the bank's importance as an arm's-length, discreet facilitator of payments in line with UAE foreign policy. This included payments to mercenary organisations operating in Libya, Yemen, and Syria.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Attribution of sensitive intelligence with appropriate hedging
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly attributes sensitive claims to specific source type while maintaining source protection
